Text: It's time to go from a pandemic to endemic. I sat down with @wbkotv last week to share why I’m calling on President Biden to come up with a plan to end the #COVID19 public health emergency. Watch the interview here: https://t.co/ERFpnvF5wY

More information and how to apply can be found here:
https://t.co/7WQOD7UsP1

For Kentuckians in Barren, Hart, and Warren counties, SBA has extended the deadline to apply for a physical disaster loan to March 14 for businesses, private nonprofit organizations, homeowners, and renters to help with physical property damage from the December 10-11 tornadoes.

Today we honor the service and legacy of those who have served as Commander-in-Chief. On this day, I would like to especially recognize Abraham Lincoln, who was born in Hodgenville in Kentucky’s Second District.

FEMA Disaster Recovery Centers will closed next Monday for Presidents’ Day. Greenwood Mall in Bowling Green is the only location in #KY02. Deadline to apply for FEMA’s Individual Assistance Program is March 14th. Please contact my office if you have any questions.

We discussed the local impact of the fentanyl and opioid crisis. I shared my recent trip to the Southern Border. President Biden’s mismanagement of our border is making KY a border state with illegal drugs. I also shared a bill I’m working on to combat illicit fentanyl analogues.

I enjoyed meeting with Brandenburg Mayor Ronnie Joyner, Muldraugh Mayor Joseph Noon, and Meade County’s Fiscal Court last week. I received an update on ongoing projects in Meade County. https://t.co/nhp980RCW8

This week I had the honor to call Cooper Otalora of Elizabethtown and Luke Payne of Owensboro to share that they've both earned appointments to West Point. As a graduate of West Point, I was excited to share this news with these hardworking students. Congrats Cooper and Luke!
I’m working to combat fentanyl-related substances through the HALT Fentanyl Act. Learn more about the HALT Fentanyl Act here: https://t.co/QSLQjFIxlb

It was great to be in Shepherdsville last Friday. I met with Bullitt County’s Fiscal Court and mayors, and we discussed local issues, including illicit fentanyl. Fentanyl is extremely deadly and has been hurting communities and families in Kentucky. https://t.co/o4rrNoHEbp

Last Thursday I was in Hardinsburg to hear from the Fiscal Court and mayors in Breckinridge County. Thanks to these local officials for your time last week. As the representative of Breckinridge County in Congress, I am working hard to stay up-to-date on local needs. https://t.co/MczUT2LTra

Update for Kentuckians in Barren, Hart, and Warren counties: The deadline has been extended again to March 14th to apply for FEMA’s Individual Assistance Program. If you have already applied for this assistance, you don't need to do so again. 

Learn more: https://t.co/pGSQgYY93B

Happy birthday to President Abraham Lincoln! Kentucky’s Second District is the proud home of Abraham Lincoln’s birthplace and @LincolnBirthNPS. 

Learn more about the national park here: https://t.co/FABYMQeI8v

Important update on tornado disaster assistance: The deadline for FEMA’s Individual Assistance Program has been extended to Sunday, March 13th. There is no need to apply again if you have already done so.

https://t.co/pGSQgYY93B

This week I joined the entire KY delegation in requesting President Biden to approve Governor Beshear’s major disaster declaration request. If approved, this would open up additional federal assistance for communities impacted by tornadoes & severe weather around New Year's Day. https://t.co/b8sOwLW2W0

Inflation increased 7.5% after 1 year of President Biden’s presidency. Paychecks aren't going as far in the Biden economy to pay for gas, groceries, & everyday goods. Kentuckians continue to pay for Washington Democrats’ failed leadership, socialist policies, & massive spending.

This week I had the opportunity to meet with a group of leaders representing independent colleges and universities in Kentucky. I'm proud to support KY schools that are leading the charge to ensure students are equipped with the skills they need to be successful in the workforce. https://t.co/TZmKawCOon
I'm proud to support law enforcement and ensure they have the tools needed to keep our communities safe.

I’m working to pass the HALT Fentanyl Act to permanently give law enforcement the ability to keep these drugs off our streets and prevent many deadly fentanyl-related substances from becoming street legal.

Yesterday I met with a group of Kentucky Sheriffs. We discussed the ongoing border crisis & how to stop illicit drugs from flooding into our communities. Illicit fentanyl has been a main driver of overdose deaths & was responsible for over 70% of KY drug overdose deaths in 2020. https://t.co/dBe9yuAkBs

If Democrats were serious about increasing America’s global competitiveness against China, then they would have not written "coral reef" & "climate change" more times than "China" in their "competition" bill.

My full statement on voting against this bill:
https://t.co/ngBI8WXEvL

On the House floor I pressed for the passage of the HALT Fentanyl Act to permanently schedule fentanyl analogues. If Democrats allow the temporary scheduling to expire on Feb 18, many deadly fentanyl analogues would become street legal. We must keep this lifesaving tool in place. https://t.co/ytxS3e7z1D

HHS Sec. Becerra’s leadership appears to be largely missing & has even been called “invisible.” This comes as Americans are frustrated with confusing COVID-19 guidance from the Biden Administration. Work for House Republicans’ Healthy Future Task Force is underway to deliver health care solutions for the American people. Today @VernBuchanan and I, as the task force's co-leaders, hosted a discussion between CBO and task force members on lowering health care costs. https://t.co/tQ5JAjpUkX

On the anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz-Birkenau, we recognize #HolocaustRemembranceDay. Each year on this day we remember all the lives lost and the bravery of those who faced pure evil. Anti-Semitism is unacceptable in our country and anywhere else in this world.

Today we honor Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. and recognize the impact he has had on our great country.
 
Reminder, FEMA Disaster Recovery Centers are closed today and certain DRCs will reopen 8 am local time tomorrow if you need assistance with obtaining relief from the tornadoes.

Update on Disaster Recovery Centers (DRCs) hours:

-DRCs will be closed next Monday, January 17th in honor of Martin Luther King Jr. Day
-DRCs will now be closed on Sundays, including January 16th
-8 a.m. to 6 p.m. local time Monday through Saturday are regular DRC hours

Common reasons people who are eligible were denied assistance are missing Social Security numbers or documents proving ownership or residence of a home, checking a wrong box in the application, or submitting an application without starting the process with their insurance yet.

My office and I are here to help you navigate the bureaucracy to receive FEMA individual assistance from the tornadoes. I’m working with FEMA to improve their communications on why people were denied assistance. Below is info on how to appeal a decision: https://t.co/XBqhUHO21z

I will continue to press for a more streamlined process with better communications for impacted Kentuckians to gain access to the critical resources they need as soon as possible without getting caught up with bureaucratic red tape.

I brought attention to the issues Kentuckians are having with navigating the federal bureaucracy to get the assistance they need. I appreciate their visit today and the work that FEMA is doing in Kentucky.

I hope that First Lady Dr. Jill Biden and Deputy FEMA Administrator Erik Hooks took away from their visit to Bowling Green the level of destruction members of our community faced and the challenges we are still facing with rebuilding. https://t.co/tPvCoWgIT1

Today is the first day of the 2nd session of the 117th Congress. Thanks to Kentucky’s 2nd District for giving me the opportunity to serve you. My office and I can work on your behalf with the federal government and navigate casework with federal agencies, including FEMA and VA.

If you do not have health insurance and lost prescriptions and medical equipment due to tornadoes in Kentucky, the Emergency Prescription Assistance Program (EPAP) may be able to help you replace certain prescription medications and medical equipment.

I would like to wish everyone a Happy New Year. I am thankful that you give me the opportunity to be your representative. This year I will focus on rebuilding our communities impacted by tornadoes and continue fighting for your values in Congress.

My family and I would like to wish you a Merry Christmas. Today I am especially thinking of Kentuckians who lost their loved ones or their homes from the tornadoes this month. My prayers continue to be with you during this challenging time.

Last night Barren County was added to the Major Disaster Declaration and individuals in Barren Co. can now apply for FEMA’s Individual Assistance Programs at https://t.co/faDmzX3OYU. You can also find more info on federal resources on my website at https://t.co/vMQyVclMGz.

Barren, Hart, and Warren counties in Kentucky's Second District are only eligible for this assistance right now. I supported the original Major Disaster Declaration with Warren County, and I advocated directly to FEMA on behalf of Barren County’s request.

Today the Small Business Administration is opening their Small Business Recovery Center at the Western Kentucky University Center for Research and Development. Hours of operation will be Monday-Friday 8am-5pm, closed 12/24 and 12/31.

I encourage my constituents in Kentucky's Second District to contact my DC office at (202) 225-3501 or Bowling Green office at (270) 842-9896 if we can be of assistance to you with obtaining federal aid and resources. You can also visit https://t.co/vMQyVclMGz for more resources.

Today I toured Hart County to survey tornado damage with my staff and local officials after spending yesterday in Warren County. I am grateful for all the work Kentuckians have done to support the Commonwealth during this dire time. https://t.co/mX7Ohdl8rW

FEMA Mobile Registration Center is open today in Hart Co. at the Hart County Floral Hall at 2184 S. Dixie Hwy, Munfordville, KY 42765. Hours of operation this week M-F 8am-5pm, except for Christmas Day. To learn more about FEMA assistance programs, visit: https://t.co/gpGcbjJ25O.
For in-person assistance, you can visit the Old Sears Building this week Monday- Friday between 8 AM-6 PM and then on 12/26 between 12-6 PM. The Disaster Recovery Center will be closed on Christmas.

Today I met with FEMA reps at the local Disaster Recovery Center in Bowling Green. FEMA is providing debris cleanup and casework help for impacted individuals. You can learn more about FEMA programs here: https://t.co/gpGcbjJ25O. https://t.co/NhjxQSWvlD

Beth and I are praying for Senator Johnny Isakson’s family. Senator Isakson was a public servant and a champion for veterans across the nation, who deeply cared for those he served and was respected by his colleagues on both sides of the aisle.

Kentuckians may have access to several types of federal assistance for a certain amount of time following the tornadoes. My staff and I are working to answer questions and help constituents navigate these resources. Learn more on my website: https://t.co/pGSQgYY93B

Hart & Warren counties in #KY02 are only eligible right now. I supported the original Major Disaster Declaration with Warren County & I led a KY delegation letter to expand eligibility to other counties, including Hart. I hope other #KY02 counties we requested are approved soon.

Today Hart County was added to the Major Disaster Declaration, which means individuals in Hart County are eligible for FEMA’s Individual Assistance Programs. Individuals in Hart and Warren counties can apply for assistance here: https://t.co/faDmzX3OYU

The Bowling Green VA Clinic may stay closed longer depending on damage and how long repairs take. Visit https://t.co/jrTvMNYuRv or call 270-782-0120 (Bowling Green VA Clinic) or 615-225-3600 (Albion Street VA Clinic in Nashville) for questions or rescheduling appointments.

Statement ⤵️

At Fort Knox there's a parade field named after Private Brooks, called Brooks Field. We'll never forget the sacrifices of service members from KY and across the nation at Pearl Harbor and throughout the war. Today serves as another reminder that the freedoms we enjoy aren't free.

Right after the attack on Pearl Harbor, Japanese forces descended on U.S. forces in the Philippines. A young Kentuckian, named Private Robert H. Brooks, lost his life as he heroically ran to his station to fight against the bombers. He was the first U.S. Armored Forces casualty.

On the 80th anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor we remember and honor those who we lost and those who bravely fought back against Japanese forces. Today I also want to recognize the Harrodsburg Tankers.

I’m standing against President Biden’s #COVID19 vaccine mandate on health care heroes. I'm concerned about the impact on health care workers' livelihoods and patients trying to access care as we’re seeing a health care workforce shortage that could be exacerbated by this mandate. https://t.co/gly4YALVfo

From serving in the Army to Senate and as a champion for veterans, Senator Bob Dole truly exemplified what it means to dedicate one’s life to our great country. Beth and I will be keeping his family and friends in our prayers.
